name: Hot Chocolate Fudge Cake
description: Recipe video above. Think of it as a sliceable version of Chocolate Self Saucing Pudding - with a LOT more chocolate fudge sauce! The perfect cosy dessert for cool winter days that's easy to make.
recipeIngredient: 1 cup caster/superfine sugar ((sub ordinary white sugar))
1/2 cup milk (, full fat, at room temperature)
75g / 5 tbsp  unsalted butter (, melted and cooled slightly)
1 tbsp oil ((canola, veg or other neutral oil) - keeps cake moist for days)
1 cup thickened / heavy cream, or pure cream ((not low fat, too thin))
1 1/4 cups dark chocolate melts or chips ((US: semi-sweet chips) - or finely chopped 60 - 70% cocoa chocolate block (Note 3))

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 180°C/350°F (160°C fan). Grease a 20cm/8" cake pan with butter then line with paper.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat oven to 180°C/350°F (160°C fan). Grease a 20cm/8" cake pan with butter then line with paper.

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk Dry ingredients in a large bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Whisk Dry ingredients in a large bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Add Wet - Then add all the Wet ingredients EXCEPT the boiling water. Whisk until combined. Then add the boiling water and whisk until smooth. The batter will be pretty thin.
recipeInstructions.name: Add Wet - Then add all the Wet ingredients EXCEPT the boiling water. Whisk until combined. Then add the boiling water and whisk until smooth. The batter will be pretty thin.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake 40 min - Pour into the pan. Bake for 40 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the centre comes out mostly clean - a faint smear of batter isn't a bad thing, we're making a fudge cake here!
recipeInstructions.name: Bake 40 min - Pour into the pan. Bake for 40 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the centre comes out mostly clean - a faint smear of batter isn't a bad thing, we're making a fudge cake here!

recipeInstructions.text: Cool in the pan for 10 minutes. Invert onto a plate, then onto a cooling rack or plate right side up. Cool for a further 10 minutes - the cake will still be warm for serving.
recipeInstructions.name: Cool in the pan for 10 minutes. Invert onto a plate, then onto a cooling rack or plate right side up. Cool for a further 10 minutes - the cake will still be warm for serving.

recipeInstructions.text: Serving - Cut slices of the warm cake. Top with a scoop of ice cream. Douse with fudge sauce - just shy of 1/4 cup per slice (10 slices). Eat and swoon!
recipeInstructions.name: Serving - Cut slices of the warm cake. Top with a scoop of ice cream. Douse with fudge sauce - just shy of 1/4 cup per slice (10 slices). Eat and swoon!

itemListElement.text: Heat cream until hot, just before boiling point, using your method of choice - saucepan or microwave.
itemListElement.name: Heat cream until hot, just before boiling point, using your method of choice - saucepan or microwave.

itemListElement.text: Stand 5 min - Put chocolate in bowl. Pour over hot cream. Ensure all chocolate is submerged, then cover with a plate. Leave for 5 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Stand 5 min - Put chocolate in bowl. Pour over hot cream. Ensure all chocolate is submerged, then cover with a plate. Leave for 5 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Mix - Using a whisk or rubber spatula, mix vigorously until the cream and chocolate combine into a silky chocolate sauce.
itemListElement.name: Mix - Using a whisk or rubber spatula, mix vigorously until the cream and chocolate combine into a silky chocolate sauce.

itemListElement.text: Cool to thicken for 20 minutes. Give it a stir then pour into a jug for serving!
itemListElement.name: Cool to thicken for 20 minutes. Give it a stir then pour into a jug for serving!

review.reviewBody:
Made this delicious cake with French onion pork chops for Sunday supper with friends.
Her favorite: French onion soup
His favorite: Anything chocolate
Hit the mark on both counts!!!  
Delicious and wonderfully easy prep for a relaxed dinner party with dear friends!!

Omg this cake is divine. Exactly what I wanted; rich, chocolatey and served with a big scoop of thick double cream. Reheated leftovers tonight and it was just as perfect as the night before. I would definitely rebel like Dozer if this cake was kept away from me! Thanks Nagi

Hands down my favourite dessert recipe of Nagi's! Such a rich & delicious cake. Served with vanilla ice cream as suggested and compliments well. I will be making this again soon! Also, ridiculously easy to make! win win!
My almost 8 year made this with limited supervision. She loved how simple it was and how great it tasted. The dinner guest she made it for were also impressed.

Oh my - you did it again! Your recipes never fail to amaze me at how simple, yet far above average they turn out.  I made this cake and ended up not using it so I threw it in the freezer. Perfect for a last minute dinner party two weeks later and tasted as moist and fresh as could be. Everyone loved it! “Blessings upon your hands, Nagi” (as they say here in Greece!)
Fantastic. Quick and easy recipe but sure doesn't taste like it. Made this for my husband as a 'just because'. We both loved it. Thanks!
